Text_English: That has no sense!
Text_Spanish: ¡Eso no tiene sentido!

Text_English: That has nothing outstanding
Text_Spanish: No tiene nada del otro mundo

Text_English: Nothing to tell
Text_Spanish: Nada que decir

Text_English: I see no reason for doing that
Text_Spanish: No veo razón para hacer eso

Text_English: I don't get it - Too complicated
Text_Spanish: No lo pillo - Es demasiado complicado

Text_English: I already thought that
Text_Spanish: Ya le di una vuelta a aquello

Text_English: That is a great idea!
Text_Spanish: Es una genial idea!

Text_English: Good morning Reme
Text_Spanish: Buenos días Reme

Text_English: Be careful! It's just cleaned
Text_Spanish: Me vas a pisar lo fregado!

Text_English: (Oh... pretty clean)
Text_Spanish: (Limpísimo está)

Text_English: Do you know if WC is usable today?
Text_Spanish: Sabes si el aseo está usable hoy?

Text_English: It always works. It's you and all the scum living here who think you are highborn
Text_Spanish: Claro que funciona. Tú y toda la morralla que vivís aquí os pensáis que sois marqueses

Text_English: It's downstairs as always! Be fast. Now there is nobody using it
Text_Spanish: Está en el piso de abajo como siempre! Sé rápido. Ahora mismo no hay nadie usándolo

Text_English: Well! Have a nice day Reme!
Text_Spanish: Bueno! Que tengas un florido día Reme!

Text_English: I moved to find a job. It is important to find something as soon as possible
Text_Spanish: Me trasladé aquí para encontrar trabajo. Es importante encontrar algo tan pronto como sea

Text_English: They are offering cooker job in center of city. I don't know how this offer came here. I could try! It's called 'El maño'
Text_Spanish: Se necesita cocinero en el centro de la ciudad. No sé ni cómo este anuncio ha llegado hasta aquí. Se podría intentar! El lugar se llama 'El maño'

Text_English: First I need to know WHERE to go
Text_Spanish: Primero necesitaría saber a dónde voy

Text_English: I need to give a good first impression. Cannot go in this way
Text_Spanish: Debo dar una buena impresión. No puedo ir así

Text_English: Self cleaning only with water is a mess
Text_Spanish: Lavarse solo con agua es una guarrada

Text_English: Now that's actually self cleaning
Text_Spanish: Ahora esto sí que es asearse

Text_English: Now that's actually good smelling! My father gifted it to me
Text_Spanish: Esto sí que es oler bien! Mi padre me lo regaló

Text_English: Using perfume not being washed is a pig fact. Not my style
Text_Spanish: Echarse perfume sin estar limpio es muy cerdo. No es mi estilo

Text_English: It's a matter of making it last as long as possible. I already used it
Text_Spanish: Lo suyo es que el perfume me dure. Ya me he echado

Text_English: Do you want to play with cards?
Text_Spanish: Quiere usted jugar una partidilla de cartas?

Text_English: WHO did you think I am? Card games is pure evil
Text_Spanish: QUIEN se ha creido que soy? Los juegos de naipes son el mismísimo demonio

Text_English: Don't sleep
Text_Spanish: No dormir

Text_English: Sleep for a while
Text_Spanish: Echarse un rato

Text_English: Sleep until next day
Text_Spanish: Dormir hasta el día siguiente

Text_English: That neighborhood is dangerous. Don't need to go there
Text_Spanish: Ese barrio es muy peligroso. No necesito pasar por ahí

Text_English: Excuse me sir. It will be only one second
Text_Spanish: Disculpe. Solo será un segundo

Text_English: Young! Don't you see I'm busy?
Text_Spanish: Joven! No ves que estoy ocupado?

Text_English: Please go to queue if you want something
Text_Spanish: Por favor. A la cola si quieres algo

Text_English: Hello!
Text_Spanish: Hola!

Text_English: How is it going sir?
Text_Spanish: Cómo va la cosa señor?

Text_English: Did you do a reservation?
Text_Spanish: Hizo reserva para hoy?

Text_English: I saw a note out there. You are searching for a cooker. Right?
Text_Spanish: Vi una nota. Estáis buscando un cocinero. Verdad?

Text_English: Yes. That was six months ago! We have a cooker and things are going on quite good
Text_Spanish: Sí. Eso fue hace seis meses! Tenemos cocinero y las cosas están yendo bastante bien

Text_English: I see... Ok. So you are not looking for any worker here
Text_Spanish: Ya veo... Ok. Entonces no estáis buscando a ningún trabajador aquí

Text_English: I'm sorry for you. By the moment is all covered here
Text_Spanish: Lo siento por ti. Por el momento aquí está todo cubierto

Text_English: Do you know about some business here looking for a worker?
Text_Spanish: Conoces de algún negocio por aquí que busquen trabajadores?

Text_English: By the moment... Just wait. I guess Pharmacist in this street was looking for help
Text_Spanish: Por el momento... Espera. Creo que el boticario de esta calle estaba buscando ayuda

Text_English: What are you cooking today?
Text_Spanish: Qué cocináis para hoy?

Text_English: How good is you are asking for it!
Text_Spanish: Qué bueno que lo preguntes!

Text_English: We have boar from La Mancha with potatoes. Also carrot for dessert
Text_Spanish: Tenemos jabalí manchego con patatas. Y de postre zanahoria

Text_English: Yuuk
Text_Spanish: Puaj

Text_English: Are you eating here today?
Text_Spanish: Comerás aquí hoy?

Text_English: Nope
Text_Spanish: No

Text_English: It's incredible. There is no free place this night!
Text_Spanish: Impresionante. No queda un hueco esta noche

Text_English: They are tasting boar with potatoes! But I fear they won't come again if we don't offer new menus
Text_Spanish: Están probando el jabalí con patatas! Pero temo que no volverán hasta que no ofrezcamos menus nuevos

Text_English: Do you know of a new receipt for this restaurant? You wanted to be cooker. Right?
Text_Spanish: Conoces nuevas recetas para el restaurante? Tú querías ser cocinero. Verdad?

Text_English: If you find out new recipes. Don't hesitate and come one morning and tell me. I will reward you
Text_Spanish: Si averiguas nuevas recetas. No dudes en acercarte una mañana y contarme. Te recompensaré

Text_English: I'll review my sources and keep you informed. Sir!
Text_Spanish: Revisaré mis fuentes y te mantendré informado. Señor!

Text_English: Have a nice day!
Text_Spanish: Que tenga un buen día!

Text_English: Restaurant owner needs a new recipe to have new customers. He promises a reward
Text_Spanish: El dueño del restaurante necesita una nueva receta para tener nuevos clientes. Él promete una recompensa

Text_English: Is this umbrella yours? Somebody left it days ago. God people don't take what doesn't belong to them
Text_Spanish: Es tuyo el paraguas? Alguien se lo dejó hace días. La gente de Dios no se apropia de lo que no es suyo

Text_English: I'll give you back some day!
Text_Spanish: Te lo traeré de vuelta algún día!

Text_English: You must try the wine
Text_Spanish: Tienes que probar el vino!

Text_English: For sure! I'm getting dry with this meat
Text_Spanish: Desde luego! Me estoy quedando seco con esta carne

Text_English: Card match is promising this night
Text_Spanish: La partida de naipes esta noche va a ser de cine

Text_English: It was a poor man suffering of a bad dinner
Text_Spanish: Era un pobre hombre sufriendo de una mala cena

Text_English: (Prrrrr)
Text_Spanish: (Prrrrr)

Text_English: Is this going to end somewhen?
Text_Spanish: Esto va a acabar algún día?

Text_English: This is torture
Text_Spanish: Esto es una tortura

Text_English: I should have never eat that dinner
Text_Spanish: Nunca debí cenar allí

Text_English: Terrible night. Ah?
Text_Spanish: Terrible noche. No?

Text_English: It was that Maño restaurant. Boar was terrible
Text_Spanish: Era el restaurante del Maño. El jabalí estaba horrible

Text_English: I saw it full of people. Don't think it was in bad state
Text_Spanish: Lo vi a reventar de gente. No creo que estuviera precisamente malo

Text_English: Well. Maybe my stomach is not in mood!
Text_Spanish: Bueno. Mi estómago no está por la labor

Text_English: Are you going to end today?
Text_Spanish: Piensas terminar algún día?

Text_English: Haha. Very funny. If I could. I would be out there. Night is young
Text_Spanish: Jaja. Muy gracioso. Si pudiera. Estaría por allí. La noche es joven

Text_English: How can I help you?
Text_Spanish: Como podría ayudarte?

Text_English: This nasty Inn is cutting water at night. I cannot let this in this state
Text_Spanish: Esta asquerosa pocilga está cortando el agua por las noches. No puedo dejar esto así

Text_English: Ahh. I see...
Text_Spanish: Ahh. Ya veo..

Text_English: Could you please talk to someone to bring water again?
Text_Spanish: Podrías por favor hablar con alguien para que vuelva el agua?

Text_English: I will see what can I do. But personnel is absent during day. Even worse at night
Text_Spanish: Veré lo que puedo hacer. Pero si ya el personal está ausente durante el día. Imagina por la noche

Text_English: I need to go. Sorry for your situation!
Text_Spanish: Necesito irme. Lamento la situación!

Text_English: Did you come to laugh at my disgrace?
Text_Spanish: Viniste a reirte de mi desgracia?

Text_English: Did I wake you up?
Text_Spanish: Te desperté?

Text_English: Are you from health department?
Text_Spanish: Eres del ministerio de sanidad?

Text_English: A poor man can't leave WC because there is no water in toilet system
Text_Spanish: El pobre hombre no puede irse porque no hay agua en las cisternas de los inodoros

Text_English: It seems to be a valve in back alley but is closed
Text_Spanish: Parece haber una válvula en el callejón de atrás pero está cerrada

Text_English: When water came back. This man gave me an invitation to a Pub where I could meet someone for a job
Text_Spanish: Cuando el agua volvió. Este hombre me dio una invitación a un Pub donde podría conocer a alguien para un trabajo

Text_English: It is a tiny cockroach! The only living being human is terrified of
Text_Spanish: Es una cucarachita pequeña! El único ser vivo al que el ser humano teme

Text_English: This pipe may bring water to toilets and is comming from outside
Text_Spanish: This pipe may bring water to toilets and is comming from outside

Text_English: It squeezed! I need to try it again or be smarter
Text_Spanish: Se escapó! Necesito volver a intentarlo o ser más listo que ella

Text_English: It seems like a closed box for some mechanism
Text_Spanish: Parece una caja de control de algún mecanismo

Text_English: Its a normal pipe
Text_Spanish: Es una tubería normal

Text_English: This is the next part of toilets pipe. Therefore Its valve should be in that box
Text_Spanish: Esta es la continuación de la tubería de los aseos. Por lo que la válvula debería estar en ese cuadro

Text_English: Valve to activate water should be inside that box
Text_Spanish: La válvula para abrir el agua debería estar dentro de ese cuadro

Text_English: Door is unlocked. But its hard to open. I can't put my fingers inside and open
Text_Spanish: La cerradura está abierta. Pero es difícil de abrir. No me caben los dedos en la rendija para abrir

Text_English: I don't want to be seen manipulating things at this hour
Text_Spanish: No quiero que me vean manipulando cosas a esta hora del día

Text_English: It's a shoelace lost from some guest
Text_Spanish: Es el cordón de bota de algún huesped

Text_English: I don't have a reason to take it
Text_Spanish: No tengo razón para cogerlo

Text_English: Maybe it could be useful to open things
Text_Spanish: Podría ser útil para abrir cosas

Text_English: This valve seems to control water flow to Inn building
Text_Spanish: Esta válvula parece controlar el flujo de agua a la pensión

Text_English: Much easier with lace help!
Text_Spanish: Mucho mejor con ayuda del cordón!

Text_English: Water should be flowing now inside!
Text_Spanish: El agua ahora debería fluir hacia la pensión

Text_English: I am not manipulating that thing again
Text_Spanish: No pienso volver a manipular eso

Text_English: He was the man suffering in WC. Now in a better and less embarrassing state
Text_Spanish: Era el hombre que sufría en el aseo. Ahora en un mejor y menos lamentable estado

Text_English: So. Isn't it the end of the night for you?
Text_Spanish: Entonces. La noche no acaba aquí?

Text_English: Nope. As I told you night is so young
Text_Spanish: No. Como te dije la noche es joven

Text_English: Where are you facing to?
Text_Spanish: A dónde irás ahora?

Text_English: There is a club in the south neighborhood
Text_Spanish: Hay un club en el barrio sur

Text_English: This pub you mentioned...
Text_Spanish: Este club que comentas...

Text_English: Aha?
Text_Spanish: Aha?

Text_English: You think I could meet people there or ask for job?
Text_Spanish: Crees que puedo conocer a gente allí o encontrar trabajo?

Text_English: For sure gentleman. Even if it's in south neighborhood. Some business are running well there. You should go some day
Text_Spanish: Por supuesto caballero. Incluso siendo el barrio sur. Algunos negocios están yendo bien. Deberías pasarte un día

Text_English: I would be pleased
Text_Spanish: Me encantaría

Text_English: For sure. Take this invitation. It's kind of private and they won't let strangers go inside
Text_Spanish: Por supuesto. Toma esta invitación. Es un poco privado y no dejan entrar a desconocidos

Text_English: Thank you!
Text_Spanish: Gracias!

Text_English: Well. See you there!
Text_Spanish: Bueno. Nos vemos pronto!

Text_English: I'm happy to see you in a better state!
Text_Spanish: Me alegro de verte en mejor estado

Text_English: I really appreciate your help this night
Text_Spanish: Agradezco en verdad tu ayuda esta noche

Text_English: It seems something was written over the invitation and a relief remains. Maybe I could guess what was written
Text_Spanish: Parece que se escribió algo sobre la invitación y queda algo de relieve. Quizá pudiera averiguar qué se escribió

Text_English: An annotation which said <<Less tales and more bread>>. Maybe it was only a coloquialism
Text_Spanish: Una inscripción que decía <<Menos cuento y más pan>>. Quizá solo sea una frase dicha

Text_English: It's an inkwell which pharmacist uses
Text_Spanish: Es un bote de tinta que usa el farmacéutico

Text_English: When inkwell flipped left a drop of ink
Text_Spanish: El bote al volcar dejó un charco de tinta

Text_English: Don't annoy and don't lift my things!
Text_Spanish: No molestes ni cojas cosas que no son tuyas!

Text_English: Maybe if I reach it from far with umbrella...
Text_Spanish: Quizá si lo alcanzo de lejos con el paraguas...

Text_English: Stop doing things! IDIOT
Text_Spanish: Estate quieto! IMBÉCIL

Text_English: Are you swipping this?
Text_Spanish: Lo vas a fregar tú?

Text_English: Maybe ink could reveal that annotation
Text_Spanish: Quizá la tinta revele la anotación

Text_English: It has enough ink
Text_Spanish: Ya tiene suficiente tinta

Text_English: Last one
Text_Spanish: Last one
